intro: Jossinia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical jossia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features elliptical, glossy leaves that are often arranged oppositely along its stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
